Summary: NC for 12.2. Unstable windslab SW,W,NW and N aspects above 900m. Cornices fragile. Avalanche Hazard Moderate.
SnowDistribution: Wind scoured and bare on some aspects, some deeper drifts elsewhere. Whiteout conditions presenting challenging navigation and serious travel conditions.  Winds 30-40 mph, burly for plateau travel.
Comment: Fragile cornices continue to develop. Cornice collapse above a North-West to West aspect at 1200 metres reported on Tuesday 11th Feb.
WeatherInfluences: A dry day is expected with very strong to gale force winds from the East-South-East. The freezing level will be around 500 metres.
SnowStability: Unstable windslab will continue to develop as snow is redistributed onto South-West through West to North aspects above 900 metres. Areas affected will mostly be where accumulations gain depth in steep wind sheltered locations such as coire rims and gully tops. At lower elevations a dusting of snow will be present, while elsewhere the old snowpack will be firm and stable. Fragile cornices will continue to develop. The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Light snow showers above 400 metres overnight, and continuing until around midday. Winds were generally from the East-South-East, strong to gale force. The freezing level was around 600 metres at midday.
ObservedSnowStability: New unstable windslab continued to develop as the day progressed. These accumulations were observed on South-West through West to North aspects above 900 metres. Greatest deposits are confined to steep wind sheltered areas such as coire rims and gully tops. Elsewhere the old snowpack is firm and stable, with a dusting of new snow present above 500 metres. Slopes and plateau areas exposed to the wind have become scoured. Fragile cornices have developed. The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

Summary: SC for 12.2: Unstable windslab on SW, W and N aspects above 900 metres. Wind sheltered areas affected. Fragile cornices. Mod Haz
SnowDistribution: Variable underfoot conditions, fresh snow above 600 metres with drifting above 900 metres. Wind exposed areas bare or old firm snow and ice.  Cloud base was at 650 metres all day. Winds between 10 - 20 mph.
WeatherInfluences: No precipitation is forecast with the freezing level steady at 500 metres. Strong Easterly winds will prevail veering East-South-Easterly during the morning.
SnowStability: Areas of unstable windslab will be found on South-West through West to North aspects above 900 metres.  Locations most affected, but not confined to will be gullies, gully tops, coire rims and other wind sheltered locations, especially where depth is gained.  Fragile cornices will be found on the same aspects. The old snow pack will be icy and well bonded throughout. The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Overnight snowfall down to glen level with light snow flurries throughout the day.  Winds were strong from the East.  The freezing level was around 600 metres at midday.
ObservedSnowStability: Unstable windslab has developed on South-West through West to North aspects above 900 metres.  Wind sheltered areas are most affected especially gullies, gully tops, crag aprons and coire rims. Fragile cornices are also present on the same aspects. The old snow pack is icy with good stability throughout. The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

Summary: TO for 12.2. Snow firm and generally stable in all locations. Most snow inland on N and E aspects above 750 metres. Low hazard.
SnowDistribution: Icy paths and hillsides. Cloud base was at around 700 metres all day. Winds 30-40 mph, progress difficult and tiring.
Comment: Snow will be very hard and icy with serious consequences for any slips or falls.
WeatherInfluences: Overnight the winds will be gale force East-South-Easterly, then decreasing to strong during the early hours. The freezing level will fluctuate around 600 metres. No precipitation is expected.
SnowStability: The patchy snow cover will be firm and generally stable in all locations. Greatest snow cover will be mainly in mountain areas inland from the coastal ranges and on Northerly to Easterly aspects above 750 metres. Snow will be mostly confined to coire rims, ridge flanks and gullies. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A dry day with gale force Easterly winds. The freezing level was around 500 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: The patchy snow cover is firm and generally stable in all locations. Greatest snow cover is mostly in mountain areas inland from the coastal ranges and on Northerly to Easterly aspects above 750 metres. Snow is mainly confined to coire rims, ridge flanks and gullies. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: LO for 12/1. Snowpack stability generally good. Isolated instabilities possible gullies N,NE,E above 1100m. Low hazard.
SnowDistribution: Variable snowcover, some areas hard and icy, other places crusty, some areas have little snow, and there are some areas of water ice. Cloudy on the tops most of the day.  Winds approx 40 - 50 mph.
Comment: Little change in weather or snowpack expected over the next few days. Ice on paths will remain a hazard at most elevations.
WeatherInfluences: Cold and dry with strong East-South-Easterly winds. Freezing at most levels.
SnowStability: Little change is expected, a few isolated instabilities will persist at the tops of some gullies that face North to East above 1100 metres. Elsewhere snowpack stability will be good.  The snow surface will be variable, hard and icy in some places, with many other areas having soft snow with a breakable crust.  The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A mainly dry day with the occasional snow shower. Very strong gusty winds were very variable in direction although mainly from the South-East. The freezing level rose to around 700 metres in the afternoon.
ObservedSnowStability: A few isolated instabilities persist within windslab at the top of some North to East facing gullies above 1100 metres. Elsewhere snowpack stability is generally good. New snow deposits today are not significant. Snow surface is very variable, hard and icy in some locations, soft with a breakable crust in many others. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: GC for 12/2. Isolated instabilities mainly on N to E aspects above 900m gullies affected also fragile cornices same aspects. Low haz
SnowDistribution: A light dusting of new snow mainly above 600 metres. Some aspects wind scoured firm and often icy. Visibility was generally poor particularly in the morning. Cold Easterly winds were up to 20 mph.
Comment:
Many paths and rocks are icy and the snowpack surface firm and also icy in places where crampons are essential.
Similar forecast for next 48 hours.
WeatherInfluences: The freezing level will fluctuate but will be around 400 metres. Partly cloudy but remaining dry and quite cool with fresh to strong Easterly winds throughout.
SnowStability: Little change is expected. Isolated deep snowpack instabilities persisting, mainly on North to East aspects above 900 metres. Snowpack weaknesses will remain generally supported by an icy surface crust. Steep gully exits and coire rims most affected. Some isolated instabilities on North-West aspects may also exist. Fragile cornices will be present above wind sheltered aspects. In other locations the snowpack will be generally shallow with good stability. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A dusting of new snow fell last night and during this morning. It was a much cloudier day with poor visibility in the morning. Winds were fresh from an Easterly direction and the freezing level was around 500 metres. Brighter with some isolated clearer spells in the afternoon.
ObservedSnowStability: New snow fell mainly above 600 metres these accumulations are currently not significant. The old snowpack continues to consolidate but some instabilities persist mainly on North to East aspects above 900 metres.  Some fragile cornices are present above similar wind sheltered aspects. Snow cover on other aspects is generally frozen, shallow and stable. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: CM for 12.2 Localised instabilities will persist mainly on steep N-E aspects abve 1000m. Otherwise stability generally good. Haz Low
SnowDistribution: Icy patches on paths and hillsides. Variable snow surface; hard and icy in places, breakable crust or soft elsewhere. Cloud base was 700-800m during the morning and early afternoon. Winds 20-30 mph.
Comment: Icy patches in many places. Snow surface will be variable; hard and icy in places, soft and breakable crust elsewhere.
WeatherInfluences: It will be a dry day, with strong East-South-Easterly winds. It will be freezing at most levels.
SnowStability: Little change is expected. Localised instabilities will persist, mainly on steep North to East aspects above 1000 metres. Otherwise stability will be generally good. Small old cornices will remain in places, mainly above North to East aspects. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: There was a trace of new overnight snow. Then it was a dry cloudy day. Winds were strong generally East-South-Easterly. The freezing level was around 600 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Localised instabilities are persisting mainly on steep North to East aspects above 1000 metres. Otherwise stability is generally good. New snow was inconsequential. Small old cornices remain in places, mainly above North to East aspects. The avalanche hazard is Low.
